means: 举起，提高( upraise的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: She strode towards them, her fist upraised.
sentence.Network_cn: 她举着拳头，大步迈向他们。

sentence.Network_en: A soldier stood on the centre line of the road, his arm upraised.
sentence.Network_cn: 一名士兵站在道路中心线上，一只胳膊高高举起。

sentence.Network_en: The wicked light, and their upraised arm is broken.
sentence.Network_cn: 亮光不照恶人 、 强横的膀臂也必折断.

druggist interrupted him with an upraised hand . " Yes , it matters . I must be convinced that you deserve what I can give you . Otherwise- " he shrugged .老板抬手打断了他的话。“是的，确实有关系。我必须确信你应得我能给您的那种东西。否则——”他耸了耸肩。

entry.def: If your hand or an object is upraised, you are holding it up in the air.
